Activity: Log in to the OA system, check emails, and review previous progress. Focus on Physics engine integration.
Begin integrating the physics engine into the game. Configure the physics settings, such as gravity and collision detection. Document the initial setup and configuration.

Implement physics-based movement for the player character. Use the physics engine to simulate realistic movement and collisions. Fine-tune the physics parameters to achieve the desired feel. Ensure that it can work with current character controller.
Implement physics-based interactions with the environment. Allow the player to push objects, throw grenades, and interact with destructible environments. Write unit tests.

Tweak the physics engine to achieve the desired feel for the game. Adjust the gravity, friction, and restitution parameters to create a satisfying and engaging experience. Profile the performance of the physics engine and optimize it as needed.
Document the physics engine integration. Explain the configuration settings, the physics-based movement implementation, and the physics-based interactions.
Review the physics engine integration. Identify areas for improvement and optimization. Update the project plan accordingly.
Back up code, check for potential bugs, write daily report and send to team members. Leave work.
